title: [$250] Expense - Expense is read-only when first opened, report with RBR appears on LHN when reopened

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.39-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exp https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1524/folder/13176741/41237124/976865154 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjnsoidjosidjs1@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Admin invites member to workspace. - Member has submitted an expense in the workspace chat. - Perform the steps below as admin. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Account > Troubleshoot > Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh. 3. Go to Inbox. 4. Open workspace chat with member. 5. Click on the expense preview. BUG 1: Expense fields become read-only. 6. Click on the header subtitle to return to main workspace chat. 7. Click on the expense preview. → Expense fields are editable when opened for the second time. 8. Click on the header subtitle to return to main workspace chat. 9. Click on the expense preview. BUG 2: Transaction thread report with RBR appears on LHN, and it is grayed out with no composer. There is no way to dismiss it. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Expense fields will be editable when opened for the first time. BUG 2: No grayed out report with RBR will appear on LHN. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Expense fields become read-only when opened for the first time. The fields only become editable after reopening the expense report (Step 7). BUG 2: Transaction thread report with RBR appears on LHN, and it is grayed out with no composer. There is no way to dismiss it. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e23976c-b099-4335-ab40-ae03ae4bc01e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~021983190427374593456
  • Upwork Job ID: 1983190427374593456
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-10-28
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @FitseTLT

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @pecanoro **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761581386632969) ## Action Performed: 1. Create a new report 2. Add two non-reimbursable expenses 3. Set one expense as a positive amount and the other as a negative amount so that the report total equals $0 4. Attempt to submit the report. ## Expected Result: Reports with a $0 total should still be submittable as long as the expenses are valid and there are no blocking violations. ## Actual Result: The report cannot be submitted even though it contains valid expenses and no violations. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72086 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+2010021kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in with Expensifail account. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the transaction thread. 5. Click More > Split. 6. Click Save. 7. Delete one of the splits. 8. On the remaining expense, click Amount. 9. Edit the amount and save it. ## Expected Result: After reverting split and editing amount, expense preview will not appear twice. ## Actual Result: After reverting split and editing amount, expense preview appears twice. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4d1ad629-8503-4b45-8327-80416a98ee39 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.31-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** N **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72177 **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new private domain user 2. Enter the name 3. When prompted to join available workspaces, tap Skip 4. On the next screen, select Track and budget expenses. 5. On "Stay organized..." screen tap "Create workspace", continue 6. On "Invite members" screen tap Skip 7. Observe background of the "Test drive" screen, tap Skip ## Expected Result: User is not navigated to the self DM page after creating a workspace during onboarding ## Actual Result: New user is dropped in self dm first after creating a workspace during onboarding, then navigated to #admins ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1469/folder/13176791/41237176/972471062 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoisdjnoisjio@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create a non-reimbursable expense. 4. Open the expense thread. 5. Go offline. 6. Click More > Split. 7. Click Save. ## Expected Result: Out-of-pocket spend and Company spend will not appear because the report contains only non-reimbursable splits. ## Actual Result: Out-of-pocket spend and Company spend appear when non-reimbursable expense is split offline. Both spends disappear after returning online. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e1640f18-a798-4e3c-9b04-39cf6726542c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exp https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1469/folder/13176923/41237527/972471306 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sjdiosjdnionsj2@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Go to Reports > Expenses. 5. Go offline. 6. Select the expense via checkbox. 7. Click dropdown button > Move expense. 8. Click Create report. 9. Open the expense. 10. Go online. ## Expected Result: Expense report will show the expense details after moving the expense to a new report. ## Actual Result: Expense report shows duplicate expense previews with blank space on the left of wide RHP after moving the expense to a new report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25d794db-bddd-432a-a244-3993a8823021 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
